intro: Trichocline sinuata, commonly known as the sinuous trichocline, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves that are often reflexed at the edges, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Trichocline sinuata is often found in open grasslands and along coastal areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
